SENT.plain: A 30-year-old female and a 38-year-old male developed "definite" moyamoya disease after presenting with "probable" moyamoya disease manifesting as ischemic stroke
Angiography at first presentation demonstrated unilateral involvement with normal contralateral findings
The cases were classified as adult type "probable" moyamoya disease according to the diagnostic criteria
Follow-up angiography demonstrated the occlusive lesions had become bilateral, satisfying the criteria for "definite" cases
Serial angiography is required in adults presenting with "probable" moyamoya disease manifesting as ischemic stroke
